greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest k such that n*(n+k) + 1 is a cube.
comment: For all n, n*(n+k) + 1 is a square for k = 2.
Differs from A102305 at positions listed by A102306.
example: a(7) = 2 as 7*9 + 1 = 64 = 4^3, though 66 also qualifies but 2<66.
mathematica: Do[k = 0; While[i = n(n + k) + 1; !IntegerQ[i^(1/3)], k++ ]; Print[k], {n, 1, 55}]
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_ and Meenakshi Srikanth (menakan_s(AT)yahoo.com), May 03 2003
ext: Edited and extended by _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 11 2003
